page.title: 07NEWTON AND WESTBURN
page.content: {NEWTON}was formerly a miner's settlement serving the adjacent colliery.While the original miner's rows have been demolished,some houses remain , including a number of villas and cottages and two terraces.Whelmar Ltd.have built 95 houses for owner-occupation.The colliery is closed but the village is dominated by two pit bings.Newton Farm surrounds the village with its cows sheep and arable land, {WESTBURN}was built to serve the now demolished steel works.It has a harsh environment of one and two storey council houses and a 1960 development of flats.Redpath have an engineering work and the electricity board a generating station.Marshall's Chickens have a factory for cooked chickens.The area is one of industrial decline with waste land needing new development.
